name: .CURVE File Extension
summary: Learn about .CURVE files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: A CURVE file is a drawing created by Linearity Curve, a vector graphic design program. The drawing a CURVE file contains may consist of shapes, pen strokes, brush strokes, and/or text. Typically, these elements are split into several distinct layers, which can be edited independently of each other.

content: Graphic designers use Linearity Curve to design logos, posters, icons, and other vector-based digital artwork. By default, Curve saves the drawings that users create in its proprietary CURVE file format.

Most CURVE files contain several drawing and/or text layers, which appear as separate editable objects in Curve. Storing image elements in separate layers allows users to edit those elements individually, without modifying or disrupting the elements stored in the image's other layers.
NOTE: Curve was formerly known as Vectornator, which saved users' drawings as .VECTORNATOR files. While CURVE files and VECTORNATOR files use different file extensions, they use the same file format.

instructions: You can open a CURVE file with Linearity Curve, which is available for macOS and iOS. For example, to open a CURVE file in Curve for macOS:
Select File → Open... from Curve's menu bar.
Navigate to and open your CURVE file.
You can use Linearity Curve to convert a CURVE file to the following formats:
To do so, open your CURVE file in Curve, and then select File → Export....
